eons.name: Hadean
eons.description: Earth's violent birth. A hellish world of molten rock, asteroid bombardment, and the formation of the Moon.

keyEvents.name: Formation of Earth
keyEvents.description: Our planet forms from the solar nebula

keyEvents.name: The Birth of the Moon
keyEvents.description: A Mars-sized object collides with Earth, creating our celestial companion

keyEvents.name: Late Heavy Bombardment
keyEvents.description: Intense asteroid impacts reshape Earth's surface

eons.name: Archean
eons.description: Life emerges in a world without oxygen. Stromatolites appear, and the first continents begin to form.

keyEvents.name: First Life
keyEvents.description: The earliest evidence of life appears in ancient rocks

keyEvents.name: Photosynthesis Begins
keyEvents.description: Cyanobacteria evolve the ability to harvest sunlight

keyEvents.name: First Continents
keyEvents.description: Stable continental crust begins to form

eons.name: Proterozoic
eons.description: The longest eon. Oxygen transforms the atmosphere, complex cells evolve, and Earth freezes completely multiple times.

keyEvents.name: Great Oxidation Event
keyEvents.description: Oxygen begins accumulating in the atmosphere, poisoning most life

keyEvents.name: First Eukaryotic Cells
keyEvents.description: Complex cells with nuclei evolve

keyEvents.name: Cryogenian - Snowball Earth
keyEvents.description: Earth freezes from pole to equator

keyEvents.name: Ediacaran Fauna
keyEvents.description: First complex multicellular life appears

eons.name: Phanerozoic
eons.description: The eon of visible life. From the Cambrian explosion to the rise of humans, this is when Earth's biosphere bloomed.

keyEvents.name: Cambrian Explosion
keyEvents.description: Most major animal phyla appear in the fossil record

keyEvents.name: Great Ordovician Biodiversification
keyEvents.description: Marine life diversifies dramatically

keyEvents.name: Taconic Orogeny
keyEvents.description: Birth of the ancestral Appalachian Mountains

keyEvents.name: End-Ordovician Extinction
keyEvents.description: Second largest mass extinction

keyEvents.name: First Land Plants
keyEvents.description: Simple plants colonize the land

keyEvents.name: Age of Fishes
keyEvents.description: Fish diversify and dominate the seas

keyEvents.name: First Forests
keyEvents.description: Trees evolve and create the first forests

keyEvents.name: Late Devonian Extinction
keyEvents.description: Multiple extinction pulses eliminate 75% of species

keyEvents.name: Coal Swamps
keyEvents.description: Vast forests that will become coal deposits

keyEvents.name: First Reptiles
keyEvents.description: Amniotic egg allows life to move inland

keyEvents.name: Formation of Pangaea
keyEvents.description: All continents merge into one supercontinent

keyEvents.name: The Great Dying
keyEvents.description: Earth's largest mass extinction - 96% of marine species perish

keyEvents.name: First Dinosaurs
keyEvents.description: Small dinosaurs appear alongside other reptiles

keyEvents.name: First Mammals
keyEvents.description: Tiny, shrew-like mammals evolve

keyEvents.name: End-Triassic Extinction
keyEvents.description: Volcanic eruptions clear the way for dinosaur dominance

keyEvents.name: Age of Giants
keyEvents.description: Sauropods reach enormous sizes

keyEvents.name: First Birds
keyEvents.description: Archaeopteryx bridges dinosaurs and birds

keyEvents.name: Flowering Plants
keyEvents.description: Angiosperms revolutionize terrestrial ecosystems

keyEvents.name: Cretaceous Hypercane
keyEvents.description: Earth's most powerful storms rage in greenhouse world

keyEvents.name: Chicxulub Impact
keyEvents.description: Asteroid ends the age of dinosaurs

keyEvents.name: Mammal Radiation
keyEvents.description: Mammals diversify to fill dinosaur niches

keyEvents.name: PETM
keyEvents.description: Paleocene-Eocene Thermal Maximum - rapid global warming

keyEvents.name: Grasslands Expand
keyEvents.description: Grasses create new ecosystems

keyEvents.name: Human Ancestors
keyEvents.description: First hominins appear in Africa

keyEvents.name: Ice Age Begins
keyEvents.description: Northern Hemisphere glaciation starts

keyEvents.name: Last Glacial Maximum
keyEvents.description: Ice sheets at their greatest extent

keyEvents.name: Lake Agassiz Flood
keyEvents.description: Catastrophic draining reshapes North America

keyEvents.name: Younger Dryas
keyEvents.description: Sudden return to ice age conditions

keyEvents.name: Holocene Begins
keyEvents.description: Current interglacial period starts

keyEvents.name: Human Civilization
keyEvents.description: Agriculture and cities develop

keyEvents.name: Taupo Eruption
keyEvents.description: New Zealand's super-eruption
